{"step_by_step_thinking": "Exclusive breastfeeding is associated with evening colic, golden color stool, and prolongation of physiological jaundice. However, hemolysis due to Vitamin K deficiency is not associated with exclusive breastfeeding. Vitamin K is necessary for the production of certain proteins that help with blood clotting. It is not found in sufficient amounts in breast milk, but this does not lead to hemolysis. Hemolysis is the breakdown of red blood cells, and it is not directly related to Vitamin K deficiency.", "answer_choice": "A"}
